required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Efficacy and Safety of Tacrolimus in Refractory Rheumatoid Arthritis Patients for 6 Months and Long-term Treatment
clinical_study.official_title: Prospective Clinical Study to Observe the Efficacy and Safety of Tacrolimus in Refractory Rheumatoid Arthritis Patients for 6 Months Treatment in China

brief_summary.textblock: This study is designed to observed prospectively the efficacy and safety of 6 months and long-term treatment of Tacrolimus alone or with methotrexate (MTX) in moderate and severe Chinese RA patients who shown insufficiency response or intolerance to DMARDs

detailed_description.textblock: This study will enroll 150 cases of refractory rheumatoid arthritis (RA) patients in Chinese，who are in moderate or severe disease activity and insufficiency response or intolerance to DMARDs. The participants plan to be treated with Tacrolimus alone, or along with methotrexate (MTX) if participants were tolerant to MTX. The efficacy and safety of 6 month Tacrolimus treatment in RA patients will be evaluated with DAS28 and other disease activity indices.

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline Disease Activity Score 28 (DAS28-ESR) at 24 and longer weeks.
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 12 weeks, 24wks,36 wks,48 wks,72 wks,96 wks,120 wks,144 wks
primary_outcome.description: Change from baseline Disease Activity Score 28 (DAS28) erythrocyte sedimentation rate (ESR) at 24 and longer weeks.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline ACR20 response rate at 24 and longer weeks.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline,12 weeks, 24wks,36 wks,48 wks,72 wks,96 wks,120 wks,144 wks
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline ACR20 response rate at 24 and longer weeks.

secondary_outcome.measure: The clinical remission rate at 24 and longer weeks.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 12 weeks, 24wks,36 wks,48 wks,72 wks,96 wks,120 wks,144 wks
secondary_outcome.description: The percentage of patients who achieve clinical remission patients at the endpoint or withdraw timepoint. High disease activity: DAS28 score exceeding 5.1, Moderate disease activity: DAS28 score of exceeding 3.2 to 5.1, Low disease activity (LDA): DAS28 score of less than or equal to 3.2, Remission: DAS28 score is less than 2.6. clinical remission means Low disease activity or remission.

secondary_outcome.measure: Clinical response was analyzed using the European League Against Rheumatism (EULAR) improvement criteria.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 12 weeks, 24wks,36 wks,48 wks,72 wks,96 wks,120 wks,144 wks
secondary_outcome.description: Good response: ΔDAS28 > 1.2 and DAS28 ≤3.2； Moderate response: 1.2 ≥ΔDAS28 > 0.6 and 3.2<DAS28 ≤5.1； or ΔDAS28 > 1.2 and still DAS28>3.2； No response:ΔDAS28≤0.6； or 1.2≥ΔDAS28 > 0.6 and DAS28>5.1。

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline Simplified Disease Activity Index (SDAI) at 24 and longer weeks.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 12 weeks, 24wks,36 wks,48 wks,72 wks,96 wks,120 wks,144 wks
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline Simplified Disease Activity Index (SDAI) at 24 and longer weeks.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline Clinical disease activity index (CDAI) at 24 and longer weeks.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 12 weeks, 24wks,36 wks,48 wks,72 wks,96 wks,120 wks,144 wks
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline Clinical disease activity index (CDAI) at 24 and longer weeks.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline Erythrocyte Sedimentation Rate (ESR) at 24 and longer weeks.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 12 weeks, 24wks,36 wks,48 wks,72 wks,96 wks,120 wks,144 wks
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline Erythrocyte Sedimentation Rate (ESR) at 24 and longer weeks.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline C-Reactive Protein (CRP) at 24 and longer weeks.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 12 weeks, 24wks,36 wks,48 wks,72 wks,96 wks,120 wks,144 wks
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline C-Reactive Protein (CRP) at 24 and longer weeks.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline swollen joint number (SW28) at 24 and longer weeks.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 12 weeks, 24wks,36 wks,48 wks,72 wks,96 wks,120 wks,144 wks
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline swollen joint number (SW28) at 24 and longer weeks. SW28 means the number of joints with swelling counted in 28 synovial joints, including proximal interphalangeal joints (10 joints), metacarpophalangeal joints (10), wrists (2), elbows (2), shoulders (2) and knees (2) bilateral.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline tenderness joint number (T28) at 24 and longer weeks.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 12 weeks, 24wks,36 wks,48 wks,72 wks,96 wks,120 wks,144 wks
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline tenderness joint number (T28) at 24 and longer weeks. T28 means the number of joints with tenderness upon touching counted in 28 synovial joints, including proximal interphalangeal joints (10 joints), metacarpophalangeal joints (10), wrists (2), elbows (2), shoulders (2) and knees (2) bilateral.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline patient global assessment(PGA) at 24 and longer weeks.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 12 weeks, 24wks,36 wks,48 wks,72 wks,96 wks,120 wks,144 wks
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline patient global assessment(PGA) at 24 and longer weeks.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline physician global assessment(PHGA) at 24 and longer weeks.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 12 weeks, 24wks,36 wks,48 wks,72 wks,96 wks,120 wks,144 wks
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline physician global assessment(PHGA) at 24 and longer weeks.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline Health Assessment Questionnaire (HAQ) at 24 and longer weeks.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 12 weeks, 24wks,36 wks,48 wks,72 wks,96 wks,120 wks,144 wks
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline Health Assessment Questionnaire (HAQ) at 24 and longer weeks.

An AE is any untoward medical occurrence in a subject, temporally associated with the use of a medicinal product, whether or not considered related to the medicinal product. An AE can therefore be any unfavorable and unintended sign (including an abnormal laboratory finding), symptom, or disease (new or exacerbated) temporally associated with the use of a medicinal product

secondary_outcome.measure: Safety assessed by incidence of serious adverse events (SAE)
secondary_outcome.description: Adverse Event is considered "serious" if the investigator or sponsor view any of the following outcomes: Death, life-threatening, persistent or significant disability/incapacity, congenital anomaly or birth defect, hospitalization, or medically important event.

arm_group.description: RA patients treated with tacrolimus, without MTX
RA patients treated with tacrolimus and MTX

intervention.description: Tacrolimus capsule: 0.5mg to 1mg, po, twice per day (Bid)，adjusted by its concentration in blood or due to patient response. Then may titer down until the endpoint.
MTX：5mg to 15mg, po, once per week (Qw) until the endpoint or adjusted due to unacceptable toxicity develops.

patient_data.ipd_description: De-identified individual participant data for all primary and secondary outcome measures will be made available within 12 months of study completion.
